revised_title: Isthmus of Panama Levelling and the Relative Height of Pacific and Atlantic Oceans
tldr: The author, John Augustus Lloyd, conducted a series of levellings across the Isthmus of Panama to determine the relative height of the Pacific Ocean at Panama and the Atlantic Ocean at the mouth of the River Chagres. Using precise instruments and careful observations, Lloyd found that the high-water mark in the Pacific was 3.55 feet higher than the high-water mark in the Atlantic. This study provided valuable information about the differences in ocean levels and tides on either side of the Isthmus.
